p: The use of the reverse genetics technique has allowed the study of HMPV proteins individually. Several studies have demonstrated how HMPV uses its proteins for viral replication and to modulate host cell responses, including the IFN-driven antiviral response. Table 2 and Figure 3 summarizes the effect that the attachment (G), matrix (M2-2), and small hydrophobic (SH) proteins have on the pathways of IFN response induction in the infected cells.
